citations.desc: Cleaning, sanitization, housekeeping, and pest control.
citations.narrative:
Approximately 60% of the primary enclosures in the North kennel have excessive feces in them. There is more than a
days worth of feces in these primary enclosures and there is a strong odor of feces inside the kennel.
Excreta and food waste must be removed from primary enclosures daily to prevent an excessive accumulation of feces
and food waste, to prevent soiling of the dogs contained in the primary enclosures, and to reduce disease hazards,
insects, pests and odors.
Clean feces and food waste from primary daily.
To be corrected by end of business March 23, 2023

The licensee has individual medical records, but the records do not include the dates of intestinal parasite treatment, or
when heartworm preventative is given.
Dealers must keep copies of medical records for dogs and make the records available for APHIS inspection. These
records must include: treatment for intestinal parasites and heartworm preventative.
Document all required information on the individual medical record to ensure the program of veterinary care is being
followed.
To be corrected by March 31, 2023
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
End Section

narrative:
3.11(a) 
   
Cleaning, sanitization, housekeeping, and pest control. 
Approximately 60% of the primary enclosures in the North kennel have excessive feces in them.  There is more than a 
days worth of feces in these primary enclosures and there is a strong odor of feces inside the kennel. 
Excreta and food waste must be removed from primary enclosures daily to prevent an excessive accumulation of feces 
and food waste, to prevent soiling of the dogs contained in the primary enclosures, and to reduce disease hazards, 
insects, pests and odors. 
Clean feces and food waste from primary daily. 
To be corrected by end of business March 23, 2023 
3.13(b) 
   
Veterinary care for dogs. 
The licensee has individual medical records, but the records do not include the dates of intestinal parasite treatment, or 
when heartworm preventative is given. 
Dealers must keep copies of medical records for dogs and make the records available for APHIS inspection. These 
records must include: treatment for intestinal parasites and heartworm preventative. 
Document all required information on the individual medical record to ensure the program of veterinary care is being

followed. 
To be corrected by March 31, 2023 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee. 
 
End Section
